text: A food court, also called a food hall, is an area inside of a building which has a number of different restaurants and snack bars located around a single area where people sit at. Food courts may be found in shopping malls, airports, and parks. They may also be found in high schools and universities, where they replace or are additions to normal cafeterias.George Beach, "High School Food Courts: A New Evolution in Student Dining", School Planning and Management; v39 n8, p22â€“23; August 2000 ==References== Category:Restaurants
title: Food court
